titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2655) to amend Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure to improve attorney accountability, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 982) to amend title 11 of the United States Code to require the public disclosure by trusts established under section 524(g) of such title, of quarterly reports that contain detailed information regarding the receipt and disposition of claims for injuries based on exposure to asbestos; and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-264, by Mr. Woodall.

The resolution provides for the consideration of H.R. 2655 and H.R. 982. In the case of H.R. 2655, the resolution provides for one hour of debate and one motion to recommit. In the case of H.R. 982, the resolution provides for one hour of general debate and makes in order only those amendments printed in the Rules Committee report. The resolution also provides for one motion to recommit the bill H.R. 982.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 72.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 403.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 195 (Roll no. 573).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 223 - 194 (Roll no. 574).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/12/2013--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2655) to amend Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure to improve attorney accountability, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 982) to amend title 11 of the United States Code to require the public disclosure by trusts established under section 524(g) of such title, of quarterly reports that contain detailed information regarding the receipt and disposition of claims for injuries based on exposure to asbestos.
